definition: to defend traditional values
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
traditionalist/moralist/champion (of a cause)

sentences.english: In the 51st minute, Maradona turned villain in the eyes of purists and moralists everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 第51分鐘，馬拉多納成爲了一些衛道士眼中的魔鬼。

sentences.english: The old guard can meet this challenge through the press and the courts.
sentences.chinese: 老一代衛道士能夠通過新聞界和法院應付這些挑戰。

sentences.english: He is considered a guardian of faith.
sentences.chinese: 他被認爲是一名衛道士。

sentences.english: In India, you will find different types of apologists.
sentences.chinese: 在印度，你可以找到不同類型的衛道士。

definition: to be chivalrous
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
sectarian bias/parochialism
code of conduct/standard of conduct
to form a clique
dissident/dissenting/dissent
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
magical/miraculous/mystical
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to be reluctant to give up a post
to be invincible/unrivalled
humanism
